q_en: Have all of John's orders been completed?
gt:
Hello there! üòÑ Let's take a look at John's orders and see if they've all been completed.

Here's a summary of the order status:

| Order ID | Total Quantity | Completed Quantity | Status       |
|----------|----------------|--------------------|--------------|
| 2        | 435            | 435                | Completed ‚úÖ |
| 10       | 150            | 0                  | Not Completed ‚ùå |

So, it seems that not all of John's orders have been completed. Order ID 2 is all done, but Order ID 10 still needs some work. If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üòä

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM customers WHERE customer_name = 'John';
steps.description: Retrieve the customer ID for the customer with the name "John"

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM orders WHERE user_id = '2';
steps.description: Retrieve all order IDs for the customer "John"

steps.sql: SELECT order_id, SUM(number) as total_quantity FROM order_product WHERE order_id IN (2, 10) GROUP BY order_id;
steps.description: Retrieve the total quantity of products for each order

steps.sql: SELECT op.order_id, SUM(st.completed_number) as completed_quantity FROM sewing_tasks st JOIN order_product op ON st.order_product_id = op.id WHERE op.order_id IN (2, 10) GROUP BY op.order_id;
steps.description: Retrieve the total completed quantity of sewing tasks for each order
